titleStmt.title: A declaration, or, representation from His Excellency, Sir Thomas Fairfax, and the army under his command, humbly tendred to the Parliament, concerning the iust and fundamentall rights and liberties of themselves and the kingdome. With some humble proposals and desires. June 14. 1647. By the appointment of his Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax, with the officers and souldiers of the army, signed John Rushworth, Secretary.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Army.

titleStmt.title: A declaration, or, representation from His Excellency, Sir Thomas Fairfax, and the army under his command, humbly tendred to the Parliament, concerning the iust and fundamentall rights and liberties of themselves and the kingdome. With some humble proposals and desires. June 14. 1647. By the appointment of his Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax, with the officers and souldiers of the army, signed John Rushworth, Secretary.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Army.
Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by George Whittington at the Blew Anchor in Corn-hill, neere the Exchange.,

notesStmt.note: Quire B is in the same setting as the edition which has "His Excellencie, Sir Tho. Fairfax" on title page.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
